snippet: The oversight panel of the Basel Committee on Banking Supervision said that the rule did not mean banks would never be allowed to dip below required levels.
abstract: Basel Committee on Banking Supervision's oversight panel will allow leeway on the so-called liquidity coverage ratio, which is intended to ensure that financial institutions have enough liquid assets to ride out a crisis; says the rule does not mean banks will never be allowed to dip below required levels.
lead_paragraph: The oversight panel of the Basel Committee on Banking Supervision said that the rule did not mean banks would never be allowed to dip below required levels.

headline.seo: Bank Regulators to Allow Leeway on Liquidity Rule
